intro: Psychotria guanchezii, commonly known as the Canary Islands Psychotria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the Canary Islands. It is a shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white petals and a distinctive yellow corona. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique microclimates of its island habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
